metadata.title: Supra molecular mechanism of the removal of 17-β-estradiol endocrine disturbing pollutant from water on functionalized iron nano particles

sections.text:
AC CE
PT ED
M AN
US CR
β-Estradiol residue in water is very dangerous and unacceptable due to its
endocrine disturbing and carcinogenetic nature. Therefore, fast, effective and ecofriendly removal method of β-estradiol is described from water. The maximum removal of β-estradiol from water was 82 percent with 600 µg L -1 amount of 17-β-estradiol, 60 minutes agitation time, 6.0 g L -1 amount of functionalized iron nano particles, 11.5 pH and 25 °C temperature. Thermodynamic parameters confirmed the spontaneous and exothermic uptake of 17-β-estradiol. The uptake of 17-β-estradiol followed first order reaction and the mechanism of uptake was through liquid film diffusion. The supramolecular mechanism of β-estradiol interaction with functionalized iron nano particles is described. The reported method is fast, effective and eco-friendly and can be applied for the uptake of β-estradiol from water at laboratory, pilot and industrial levels in any water system.
Keywords: 17-β-Estradiol, Removal, Water, Functionalized iron nano particles, Supra molecular mechanism.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text:
The incidence and fortune of pharmaceutically active molecules in the aquatic
system has been documented as one of the evolving subjects in the environmental science [1]. The steroids are important group of potential endocrine disrupting chemicals (EDCs) present in the various water resources. Theses estrogenic compounds are being used as medicinal products, pesticides and additives in animal feed. Consequently, these steroids are contaminating the various water bodies including sea water [2]. Although these compounds are found at trace levels in the environment yet effecting marine animals and humans greatly [3]. Few research papers stated that water polluted with EDCs is damaging to humen [4] because of trouble in endocrinal system. This is noteworthy to stress that the concentrations less than 1.0 ng L -1 in water situation can root sterility and deteriorate estrogenic activity, diminution reproduction of fish females [5], alteration behavior habits, that may alter reproduction of fish and decrease discharge of pituitary growth hormone (GH) [6]. Also, elevated levels of EDCs may cause reminiscence reduction and lessen thyroid function efficiency [7]. Furthermore, elevated amounts of 17-β-estradiol can root of cancer too [8]. 17-β-Estradiol is one of these EDCs which has been a concern of investigation since the 1930s [9]. 17-βEstradiol is female sex hormone (steroid and estrogen sex hormone). This is crucial in bendable estrous and female menstrual reproduction cycles. Also, this is significant for the growth and preservation of female reproductive system [10]. Consequently, 17-βestradiol is being cast-off world wide as a vital medication [11,12]. Global market place sale of 17-β-estradiol was approximately 1968 million US $ in 2013. Thus, 17-βEstradiol is contaminating our water bodies continuously [2]. Therefore, the attention is

directed towards developing effective, fast and eco-friendly adsorption methods for the removal of 17-β-estradiol from water, as adsorption considered as the universal method of water treatment [13-17]. Some workers attempted to remove 17-β-estradiol from water [18-26] but these are not effective due to high contact times and capable to work at high concentrations of 17-β-estradiol. Therefore, iron functionalized nano particles is prepared by green method and used to remove 17-β-estradiol from water at micro level.

sections.text:
The various equipments used are as given below.
17-β-Estradiol from Sigma Chemical Company, USA. LiChrosolve methanol,
ethanol, 2-propanol, n-hexane, acetonitrile from Fisher Scientific (Fairlawn, New Jersey, USA). N-methyl butyl imidazolium bromide [ionic liquid; IL] from Fluka. Ferrous sulphate, polyvinyl alcohol (PVA), petroleum ether, glacial acetic acid, ophosphoric acid and sodium dihydrogen phosphate dihydrate crystal (A.R. grade) from Qualigens Mumbai, India.

sections.heading: 2.3 Preparation and characterization of functionalized iron nano particles
sections.text:
The functionalized iron nano particles were prepared using black tea and ferrous
sulphate following fictionalization by N-methyl butyl imidazolium bromide [ionic liquid] as described earlier [27]. The prepared functionalized iron nano particles were characterized by UV-Visb., FT-IR, SEM, TEM and XRD.

sections.heading: 2.4 Removal of 17-β-estradiol from water
sections.text:
The solutions of 17-β-estradiol (100-1000 µg L -1 ) were prepared in double
distilled water. The removal experiments were done at preset stir momentum and temp. in batch method. The functionalized iron nano particles were removed by centrifugation. Chromatography (HPLC) was used to evaluate the equilibrium amount of 17-β-estradiol [28]. The uptake experiments were carried out with 100 to 1000 µg L -1 concentrations, 5 to 70 min. contact time, 1.0 to 9.0 g L -1 dose, 6 to 12 pHs and 20 to 30 °C temps. Thermodynamics and kinetics parameters were evaluated by the different isotherms. The concs. of 17-β-estradiol were calculated by the equations -
Ce = (Ci-Ct)/m -1
where, Ci = initial amount, Ct, = amount at any time, Ce = amount at equilibrium, m = weight of functionalized nano particles (g L -1 ). The percentage removal of 17-βestradiol were evaluated by equations-
% Uptake = [(Ci-Ct)/ C0]100 -2
where, Ci and Ct show the usual meanings.

sections.heading: 3.1 Characterization of functionalized nano particles
sections.text:
The functionalized iron nano particles were prepared by eco-green way by
exploiting black tea and N-methyl butyl imidazolium bromide ionic liquid. These were characterized by XRD, FT-IR, SEM and EDS methods. XRD pattern is shown in Figure 1 with at 2θ = 20 ◦ to 90 ◦ . The peak at 44.6 ◦ is attributed to zero-valent iron. Iron oxohydroxide (FeOOH) peak was also observed at 24.5 ◦ . Iron oxide peaks were seen due to the fact that the functionalized iron nano particles were partly oxidized during the synthesis. FT-IR peaks were in range of 2850-3000 cm -1 showing C-H stretching in poly vinyl alcohol which was present as a cross linker in functionalized nano particles (Figure 2). Characteristic peak of ionic liquid (N-methyl butyl imidazolium bromide) was observed in the range of 3330-3450 cm -1 (broad peak). Peak at 1039 cm -1 corresponded to C-O-C stretching, indicating water soluble polyphenols and caffeine. These results confirmed the involvement of polyphenols, poly vinyl alcohol and ionic liquid in functionalized nano particles. The surface morphology of the functionalized nano particles was detected using Scanning Electron Microscope (Figure 3). The pictures of SEM revealed that the surface is irregular with no structural mark. The pictures of SEM were taken at 15.00 K X & 5.00 K X. EDX provided elemental information about the functionalized nano particles (Figure 4). The spectra recorded indicated the presence of C, O, N, Fe, Br in functionalized nano particles. These peaks were because of X-ray release from iron nano particles that were modified with ionic liquid using poly vinyl alcohol (cross linker). The appearance of gold was due to sampling technique with gold prior to study.

sections.heading: 3.2 Uptake of 17-β-estradiol
sections.text:
The maximum uptake of 17-β-estradiol from water was achieved by adjusting
the sorption process. The various factors controlled were agitation time, concentration of 17-β-estradiol, pH of the solutions, amount of functionalized nano particles and temperature. 82 Percent removal was obtained as the maximum with 600 µg L -1 amount of 17-β-estradiol, 60 minutes agitation time, 6.0 g L -1 amount of functionalized nano particles, 11.5 pH and 25 °C temp. The outcomes of the removal process are shown in Figure 5. Interestingly, the removal of 17-β-estradiol was very poor from pH 6 to 10 but it increased sharp and suddenly at pH 10.5. Additional boost in pH could not enlarge the uptake of 17-β-estradiol. It may be due to the fact that the pKa value of 17-β-estradiol is 10.71 and at around 10.5 pH, 17-β-estradiol existed as anion and got sorbed by the intrinsic cavities and positive charge of the functionalized iron nano particles.

First order rate constant [k1] was evaluated using slop of log(Qe-Qt) versus time
in minutes (Figure 7a). The magnitude of first-order-rate constant and coefficient of determination (R 2 ) were 0.064 and 0.969; verifying suitability of first order reaction. The theoretical and experimental uptake amounts were 106.20 and 82.00 (Table 3); with difference of 24.2, which is not much and again confirming suitability of first order reaction. Second order kinetic model was also tested for uptake of 17-β-estradiol (Figure 7b) and the rate constant was 0.0.0053 (Table 3), which is too low and hence, this model was not suitable for the uptake of β-estradiol. The theoretical and experimental uptake amounts were 135.14 and 82.00; with difference of 53.14, which was much high and again this model was not suitable for uptake of 17-β-estradiol. The value of h (initial rate constant) was 3.56 (Table 3) but it reduced on proceeding of time. coefficient of determination (R 2 ) was 0.959. Adsorption [α (µg g −1 min −1 )] and desorption [β (µg g −1 min −1 )] processes are important and the values of these were 8.32 and 0.033 with coefficient of determination (R 2 ) 0.974 (Table 3); showing the suitability

Non-applicability was evaluated by the passing of graph not via origin. The film diffusion rate coefficient (kfd) was 0.0947 (µg g -1 min −1 ). These values of intercept and regression constant were 0.50 and 0.987 (Table 3). This data confirmed uptake of 17-β-estradiol by diffusion procedure. Film diffusion kinetic model graph line deviated from the origin by 0.50 magnitude, which is close to zero value. This deviation is because of high agitation during uptake of 17-β-estradiol. Such observations have been reported in the literature [29-35]. Finally, it was concluded that the uptake of 17-β-estradiol was through liquid film diffusion mechanism.

3.7 Mechanism of uptake of 17-β-estradiol at supra molecular level
The supra molecular uptake of 17-β-estradiol on functionalized iron nano
particles was established and shown in Figure 8. This supra molecular structure of functionalized iron nano particle was developed. N-methyl butyl imidazolium cation created cavities in the inter space of the functionalized iron nano particles. Such observation has been reported by Burgos et al. [36]. The N-methyl butyl imidazolium cation also developed positive charges on the functionalized iron nano particles. 17-βestradiol at pH 10.5 and above existed as the dianion. This anion got trapped into the cavities of functionalized iron nano particles. The stabilization of 17-β-estradiol dianion in the cavities of functionalized iron nano particles is established by the electrostatic force of attraction. One molecule of functionalized iron nano particles trapped five molecule of 17-β-estradiol dianion. Therefore, the uptake capability of the functionalized iron nano particles for 17-β-estradiol dianion is in the ratio of 1:5. This feature of functionalized iron nano particles made them ideal sorbent for the uptake of 17-β-estradiol. And that is why the adsorption capacity (8.32) is greater that the desorption capacity (0.033) on these functionalized nano particles.

sections.heading: 4. Conclusion
sections.text:
It is very significant and urgent to remove 17-β-estradiol from water prior to
supply to the community otherwise it may disturb the endocrine system of human beings. Besides, the contaminated water due to 17-β-estradiol may cause cancers in the community. Therefore, the results of this paper are very effective and clearly confirmed that the uptake of 17-β-estradiol from water is fast, effective and eco-friendly. The

green technology of the preparation of functionalized iron nano particles made this method eco-friendly and economic too. The interesting thing is that the presented removal system is capable to uptake 82% 17-β-estradiol from water at micro level concentration. Thermodynamic parameters confirmed the spontaneous and exothermic uptake of 17-β-estradiol. Briefly, the reported method is fast, effective and eco-friendly and can be applied for the uptake of β-estradiol from water at laboratory, pilot and industrial levels in any water system.
